thread.title: Tatarsky exhibits drawings at Gibbs Library
thread.title_full: Tatarsky exhibits drawings at Gibbs Library

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Tatarsky exhibits drawings at Gibbs Library
text:
Tatarsky exhibits drawings at Gibbs Library Oct 01, 2015 Ink drawings by local artist Ieva Tatarsky are on view at Washington’s Gibbs Library. 
Washington — The Gibbs Library, 40 Old Union Road, is exhibiting drawings by Washington artist Ieva Tatarsky through Nov. 4. 
The artist, a founding partner of the former Downtown Gallery, uses color and metallic inks to draw moving clouds, wind in trees and the crisscrossing of stems, vines and branches. Her exuberant work may be viewed during regular library hours: Mondays from 4 to 7 p.m.; Tuesdays from 9 a.m. to noon and 4 to 7 p.m.; Thursdays from 3 to 6 p.m.; Saturdays from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m.; and Sundays from 2 to 5 p.m. 
For more information, call 845-2663. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
